comments.body: Even if there is such a change from `--driver-classpath` to `--driver-class-path`, changing this line into `connection_cmd += ["--driver-class-path", self._driver_classpath]` should be enough, right? I don't think it's necessary to change all other lines.
Yes, I understand that but following the convention of other similar parameters(ex: total_executor_cores) I thought of making it consistent.
Can you add backward compatibility and a note in the `UPDATING.md` file? In future versions, we will drop support for the old parameter name.
What  version of spark first supports `--driver-class-path`? What version _stopped_ supporting `--driver-classpath`?
@ashb This option was introduced in version 1.3 and since then it has been --driver-class-path. There seems to be a typo in airflow while creating spark submit hook.
As in there was never `--driver-classpath`? If that's the case then no one could be using this so we don't have to worry about breaking anyone's install :)

@mik-laj Backward compatilibility is applicable to some thing that was working before but this option never worked, this seems to be a typo and it is also not a mandatory parameter to pass in the job so nobody cared till now.
In this case, I would suggest not to concern about the backward compatibility in this case. Adding a record saying typo fixed in UPDATING would suffice to me.
@XD-DENG I have added the record in UPDATING.md. It was closed by mistake. I reopened :)

This actually means occupy worker and do nothing for n seconds is it not?
It was OK when it was 1 second but users may set it to even 5 min without realising that it occupys the worker.

My comment here is more of a concern rather than an action to do.
Should this work by occupying the worker "indefinitely" or can it be something like the sensors with (poke/reschedule)?

I know what you mean but this is better than existing hardcoding, even changing to sleep 10 will reduce load on spark cluster. https://jira.apache.org/jira/browse/AIRFLOW-6388 raised for future re-design
